page.title: 10Building Foundations,Deepcut
page.content: The surveyor marks out the site with wooden sticks. Trenches are then dug to a depth of about one and a half metres with a JCB which is a kind of mechanical digger. Builders fill the bottom of the trenches with concrete. This concrete is delivered to the site in huge mobile concrete mixers. The bricklayer next builds two walls, with a gap between them, up to ground level. These are covered with a damp proof course, made of a plastic material, to prevent damp rising. Two layers of concrete are then laid over the inside of the house with a sheet of polythene between them. This makes the ground floor.
